abstract_summ: In India, a family-centric society with a high population density and extreme social stratification, the impact of the lockdown might vary across diverse social groups.This study aims to explore the reasons and the ways through which social distancing generates negative emotions in individuals who experienced the lockdown.OBJECTIVE Social distancing is crucial in order to flatten the curve of COVID-19 virus spreading.CONCLUSIONS The well-known Maslow's theory of human needs seems to fit well with the outbreak of negative emotions in the context of COVID-19.To a larger extent, the objective is to check the existence of relations between negative emotions and the satisfaction of basic needs.
title_summ: A nation-wide survey on emotional and psychological impacts of COVID-19 social distancing.The intensive use of the internet by children and adolescents in the context of COVID-19 and the risks for self-inflicted violence.Factors associated with people's behavior in social isolation during the COVID-19 pandemic.Psychological impact of Covid-19 lockdown in India: Different strokes for different folksPsycho-social factors associated with the nationwide lockdown in India during COVID- 19 pandemic
title_abstract_phrases: In India, a family-centric society with a high population density and extreme social stratification, the impact of the lockdown might vary across diverse social groups.A nation-wide survey on emotional and psychological impacts of COVID-19 social distancing.However, most believe that it is the most appropriate control measure and are willing to wait as long as necessary to contribute to the fight against COVID-19.Psychological impact of Covid-19 lockdown in India: Different strokes for different folksThe psychological impact of the lockdown due to the Covid-19 pandemic are widely documented.This study aims to explore the reasons and the ways through which social distancing generates negative emotions in individuals who experienced the lockdown.CONCLUSIONS The well-known Maslow's theory of human needs seems to fit well with the outbreak of negative emotions in the context of COVID-19.
